Total_Links:
Nestle India announced its Q4FY25 results, reporting a net profit of ₹885 crore, a 5% decrease compared to the same quarter the previous year.

Revenue for the quarter increased by 4.4% year-on-year, reaching ₹5,504 crore.

The company declared a final dividend of ₹10 per equity share for the financial year 2024-25, with the record date set as July 4, 2025.

The Board of Directors appointed Mr. Manish Tiwary as Key Managerial Personnel, effective April 24, 2025. This appointment was made during his transition period as Managing Director (Designate).

Nestle India launched an Employees Pet Feeding Program in May 2025, with Purina offering "paw-sitive perks" for new pet parents.

The company also launched its Automated and Paperless Distribution Center in Bhiwandi, reinforcing its commitment to sustainability and digitalization.

In April 2025, Nestle India enhanced its commitment to hill stations through a new project.

Nestle India partnered with gaming streamers for its NESCAFÉ Ready-to-Drink Cold Coffee range.

Nestle India received an administrative warning letter from SEBI on March 7, 2025, for violation of insider trading regulations by a designated person of the Company.
